questions.explanation: Correct Answer D - Measles

questions.text: A child presents with a dog bite from a street dog. On examination, an abrasion of 1.5 cm is present, with slight oozing. Which of the following statements is correct? 1. Category 3 wound 2. Wash the wound with normal tap water for 15-20 minutes 3. Clean the wound with spirit 4. Loose suturing of the wound with a proper dressing 5. Equine immunoglobulin is given a dose of 40 IU/kg of body weight, twice 6. The intradermal vaccine is administered on day 0,3,7,28

Which of the following regarding the vaccine vial monitor (VVM) is true? 1. It is used for monitoring heat exposure of the vaccine by healthcare workers in primary healthcare. 2. It shows cumulative exposure of the vaccine to the heat. 3. It can be used to assess the potential efficacy of the vaccine 4. Calculation of the expiry date can be done using VVM. 5. The expiry date of the vaccine can be relaxed if VVM is an acceptable range. 6. If the square and the circle are the same in color, then the vaccine can be safely used.
Which of the following statements is false regarding rabies immunoglobulin?

options.label: A
options.text: It is exclusively given only in the deltoid

options.label: D
options.text: If human RIG is unavailable, equine is preferred

questions.correct_answer: A. It is exclusively given only in the deltoid

questions.text: What would be the most appropriate approach to managing a young male patient who has presented at the hospital with a clean-cut wound that is not bleeding, and who received a complete tetanus vaccination 10 years ago?

options.label: A
options.text: Human tetanus immunoglobulin and full course of vaccine

questions.explanation:
Category

Clean wound

Unclean wound

Category A

Has had a complete course of toxoid or a booster dose (full immunisation) within the past 5 years.

Only wound care.

Only wound care.

Category B

Full immunization > 5 years

ago < 10 years.

Wound Care + TT single dose.

Wound Care + TT single dose.

Category C

Full Immunization > 10 years

ago.

Wound Care + TT single dose.

Wound Care + TT single dose + Human Tetanus Immunoglobulin.

 

Category D

Unknown, not known, never

taken immunisation.

Wound Care + TT complete

course.

Wound Care + TT complete

course + Human Tetanus

Immunoglobulin.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines is not recommended after 65 years?
questions.explanation:
Vaccine

Purpose

Recommended After 65?

Influenza

Prevents seasonal flu complications

Yes, annually

Pneumococcal (PCV15/PCV20, PPSV23)

Prevents pneumonia, bacteremia, meningitis

Yes, once or as per schedule

Herpes Zoster (Recombinant Zoster Vaccine - RZV)

Prevents shingles and postherpetic neuralgia

Yes, 2 doses after 50 years

Tetanus, Diphtheria, Pertussis (Tdap/Td)

Prevents tetanus and pertussis

Yes, booster every 10 years

COVID-19

Reduces risk of severe COVID-19

Yes, as per updated recommendations

HPV

Prevents cervical and other cancers

Not recommended after 45 years

questions.text: A polysaccharide vaccine against Streptococcus pneumoniae has 23 serotypes. In which of the following patients is this vaccine most beneficial ?

options.label: B
options.text: A patient with sickle cell disease

options.label: D
options.text: A patient with recurrent otitis media

questions.correct_answer: B. A patient with sickle cell disease
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - Sick

questions.text: What would be the appropriate treatment for a 5-year-old boy who had received a complete course of rabies vaccine in December 2018, but was bitten on the toe by his fully vaccinated pet dog in November 2019, resulting in bleeding at the bite site?
questions.correct_answer: B. 2 doses of vaccine on Day 0 & 3
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - 2 doses of vaccine on Day 0 & 3

questions.text: At a PHC, vaccine storage is done in?
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - Ice-Lined Refrigerator (ILR)

questions.text: What should be the minimum interval between the administration of two live vaccines ?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option B - 4 week

 

Live Vaccines

Killed Vaccines

Nature of the Vaccine

Contains a weakened or attenuated form of the infectious agent

Contains inactivated or killed versions of the infectious agent

Immune Response

Stimulates a strong immune response, including both humoral and cellular immunity

Stimulates a relatively weaker immune response primarily involving humoral immunity

Duration of Protection

Usually provides long-lasting immunity

May require booster doses to maintain immunity

Vaccine Shedding

May shed the weakened form of the infectious agent, potentially causing mild illness in rare cases

Does not shed the infectious agent

Vaccine Efficacy

Generally higher efficacy due to the replication of the weakened agent in the body

Efficacy may be lower due to the absence of replication and reduced immune response

Risk of Reversion

Small risk of reversion to a more virulent form of the infectious agent

No risk of reversion to a more virulent form

Examples

Measles, mumps, rubella, varicella (chickenpox), oral polio vaccine, yellow fever, rotavirus

Influenza (injectable), polio (inactivated), hepatitis A, pertussis (acellular), pneumococcal conjugate vaccine

questions.text: Which vaccine among the options provided is not recommended during pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option D - Varicella (Chickenpox) v

Conditions Contraindications
Pregnancy
  • All live vaccines are contraindicated except yellow fever. 
  • In India, the yellow fever vaccine is not used due to the required storage temperature.
  • Yellow fever is an exotic disease in India.

questions.text: A 4-year-old male child developed with sore throat, difficulty in swallowing, and mild fever . On examination, the clinical picture shown below is seen. Which of the following sentences is false regarding the vaccine that could have prevented this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is administered on the anterolateral aspect of the thigh.

options.label: B
options.text: A history of anaphylaxis with same vaccine is not a contraindication

options.label: C
options.text: The cellular pertussis component in the vaccine is not recommended after 7-years of age

options.label: D
options.text: The diphtheria toxoid dose in adults is much lesser than the pediatric dose

questions.correct_answer: B. A history of anaphylaxis with same vaccine is not a contraindication
questions.explanation: Correct Option B - A history of anaphylaxis with the same v

questions.text: In the laboratory, a microbiologist is preparing the BCG vaccine. Which of the following substances is used as a diluent for the BCG vaccine?
questions.explanation: Correct Option A - N

questions.text: BCG is diluted with:
questions.explanation: Correct Option A - N

questions.text: How long is the protection provided by the Yellow fever vaccine considered valid for?
questions.explanation:
Correct Option A - Life long

Vaccine

17D vaccine-strain

Storage
  • +5 to -30℃
  • Yellow fever vaccine cannot be stored under cold chain temperature in India

Type of vaccine
  • Reconstituted vaccine
  • Should be kept on ice away from light
  • Cold physiological saline diluent is added
  • Does not follow open vial policy
  • Should be used up to half an hour

Route

Subcutaneous

Dose

0.5ml at insertion of deltoid

Immunity

Immunity starts after 7-10 days and lasts lifelong
